alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 9:39AM PST until January 12 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT ABOVE 500 FEET... ...BLIZZARD WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch heavy snow remains possible above 500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 22 inches possible. As high wind speeds have eased, the Blizzard Warning will be allowed to expire. * WHERE...Cascade mountains and valleys of Snohomish and King Counties, including Darrington, Index, Skykomish, Stevens Pass, and Snoqualmie Pass. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes
